posts.post_content:
Something a lot of people here fail to mention is that you can't really chump block him without losing something big. You can't chump block with 1/1's or 2/2's because he frys them when he enters and he toasts them when he attacks.  
  
This is a solid Titan. And like someone said, if you give this deathtouch, you're essentially killing three creatures with each attack since he deals 3 damage **divided**. Take that [Grave Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Titan) :P
posts.html:
Something a lot of people here fail to mention is that you can't really chump block him without losing something big. You can't chump block with 1/1's or 2/2's because he frys them when he enters and he toasts them when he attacks.

This is a solid Titan. And like someone said, if you give this deathtouch, you're essentially killing three creatures with each attack since he deals 3 damage divided. Take that Grave Titan :P

posts.post_content:
I don't see how this guy is the weakest Titan . .   
Inferno Titan + [Mass Hysteria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mass Hysteria) = instant 12 damage?  
Let's see how many creatures opponent will have after this thing attacks and the caster casts volcanic fallout or firespout. This also has Firebreathing which ensures opponent's demise if opponent chooses not to sack a creature. That is . . . if the opponent has any remaining creatures.

Posted By: friendtoall17 (4/19/2011 8:51:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Every time I play him, I like him a little more. I use him in my red/green [Destructive Force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Destructive Force) deck along with [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan), and I have to say, I almost always like seeing him more than I like seeing his significantly more hyped greed brother. I struggle to recall a game which I have lost in which he resolved. He packs much more power than [Primeval Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primeval Titan) thanks (obviously) to his triggered ability but notably also from his often overlooked built-in [Firebreathing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Firebreathing). If the opponent has no readily available answers, the result of getting this guy on the board is frequently nine to fourteen damage dished out by him by the time he's had his first attack.   
  
I think he's the most underrated of the M11 Titans, and I give him a rock-solid 4.5/5.
posts.html:
Every time I play him, I like him a little more. I use him in my red/green Destructive Force deck along with Primeval Titan, and I have to say, I almost always like seeing him more than I like seeing his significantly more hyped greed brother. I struggle to recall a game which I have lost in which he resolved. He packs much more power than Primeval Titan thanks (obviously) to his triggered ability but notably also from his often overlooked built-in Firebreathing. If the opponent has no readily available answers, the result of getting this guy on the board is frequently nine to fourteen damage dished out by him by the time he's had his first attack.

I think he's the most underrated of the M11 Titans, and I give him a rock-solid 4.5/5.
